intro: Pycnocycla abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian pycnocycla, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Ethiopia. It is a shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often glandular and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the high-altitude regions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
